intro: Silvianthus tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin silvianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in the spring. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
